intro: Ricinocarpus schlechtendalianus, commonly known as the Schlechtendalianus sea hake, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody structure and is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture and a distinctive aroma. It thrives in saline environments and is often found growing along the shores of the Atlantic and Indian Oceans.
